string-array.item: Black Coffee
Palm Sugar Coffee
Dalgona Coffee
Latte
Milk Coffee
Caramel Macchiato
Tiramisu Coffee
V60 Coffee
Vietnamese Coffee
Avocado Coffee
Matcha Latte
French Press

string-array.name: data_description
string-array.item: This rich and bold coffee is brewed to perfection without any added milk or sugar, offering a pure, robust flavor for true coffee lovers.
Combining coffee, milk, and the natural sweetness of palm sugar, this drink features a rich caramel-like flavor that complements the boldness of the coffee.
Whipped coffee made by beating instant coffee, sugar, and hot water until fluffy, then served over cold or warm milk for a frothy, creamy treat.
Featuring a smooth layer of steamed milk over a shot of espresso, the latte creates a velvety texture and mellow flavor that’s perfect for any time of day.
Combining the boldness of coffee with the creaminess of milk, this classic beverage delivers a balanced taste for a delightful experience.
Espresso-based with steamed milk, a hint of vanilla, and a rich caramel drizzle, this indulgent drink balances bold espresso with smooth, creamy flavors.

A delightful fusion of classic coffee and the famous Italian dessert, tiramisu. This coffee combines the sweetness of cream and chocolate with the rich, smooth aroma of coffee. Perfect for those who enjoy the blend of a sweet dessert and the bold elegance of coffee.
Meticulously brewed using a V60 dripper, this pour-over coffee highlights the delicate flavors and aromas of the coffee beans with a clean and smooth finish.
Strong and sweet, this coffee is brewed with dark roasted coffee beans ground to a medium roast using a drip filter, often served with sweetened condensed milk.

This drink brings together the smooth, creamy freshness of avocado with the bold, distinctive taste of coffee. Avocado Coffee offers a unique flavor experience, where the softness of avocado perfectly complements the bittersweetness of coffee, creating a delicious and refreshing harmony.
This drink blends finely ground green tea (matcha) with steamed milk, offering a slightly sweet, refreshing, and earthy flavor that’s both energizing and soothing.
Brewed with a French press, this coffee offers a rich, full-bodied flavor with a smooth and robust taste that’s achieved through steeping coarsely ground coffee in hot water.

string-array.name: data_serving_steps
string-array.item:
1. Boil 200ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling to cool slightly(to around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12g of fine grind coffee(around 2 tablespoons)
3. Add sugar(optional)
4. Pour the hot water over the coffee grounds in the cup and stir with a spoon to mix well
5. Let the coffee sit for 3–4 minutes to allow the grounds to settle at the bottom
6. Enjoy your freshly brewed black coffee

1. Boil 100ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling to cool slightly(to around 80–85°C)
2. 12g instant coffee/coffee without grounds(around 1 tablespoons)
3. Pour 30–40ml of liquid palm sugar into the glass
4. Once the milk is hot, pour it into the glass and stir with a spoon until the coffee and palm sugar are well combined
5. Add ice cubes to the glass according to your preference
6. Stir again until all ingredients are well mixed and the drink is cooled
7. Enjoy your refreshing iced coffee with palm sugar

1. Mix 12g instant coffee, sugar, and water or a 1:1:1 ratio in a bowl
2. Beat the mixture with a hand mixer or whisk until it is fluffy and foamy, until it is golden/brown in color, and very thick in texture
3. Pour 200ml could milk into the glass
4. Pour the shaken mixture of coffee, sugar and water over the milk
5. Stir before drinking or enjoy straight with a layer of coffee on top of the milk.

1. Boil 30–40ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling to cool slightly(to around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12g of fine grind coffee(around 2 tablespoons)
3. Add sugar(optional)
4. Pour the hot water over the coffee grounds in the cup and stir with a spoon to mix well
5. Pour 150ml hot milk into the frenchpress
6. Beat the milk with a French press until it reaches a height of about 1 cm from the initial height continuously
7. make sure the foam is even (no bubbles), then pour it into a milk jug
8. Pour the milk from the milk jug into the coffee cup at an angle with a rotating motion until the cup is half full
9. Create your own latte art style as you wish
10. Enjoy your homemade coffee latte

1. Boil 100ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling to cool slightly(to around 90–95°C)
3. Add 12g of fine grind coffee(around 2 tablespoons)
4. Pour the hot water and hot milk over the coffee grounds in the cup and stir with a spoon to mix well
5. Let the coffee sit for 3–4 minutes to allow the grounds to settle at the bottom
6. Enjoy your freshly milk coffee

1. Pour 150ml of milk into a collin glass
2. Boil 50ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling until it cools down a bit (around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12g of finely ground coffee (around 2 tablespoons) into a cup or mug
3. Pour 50ml of boiled water into a cup or mug
4. Stir until well mixed
5. Add ice cubes into the collin glass of milk
6. Stir and make sure the coldness is even
7. Pour the coffee from the cup or mug into the collin glass
8. Add caramel syrup on top
9. Enjoy your homemade ice caramel macchiato

1. Pour 150ml of milk into a collin glass
2. Boil 50ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling until it cools down a bit (around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12g of finely ground coffee (around 2 tablespoons) into a cup or mug
3. Pour 50ml of boiled water into a cup or mug
4. Stir until well mixed
5. Add ice cubes into the collin glass of milk
6. Stir and make sure the coldness is even
7. Pour the coffee from the cup or mug into the collin glass
8. Add tiramisu syrup on top
9. Enjoy your homemade ice tiramisu coffee

1. Boil water and let it cool slightly to around 85–90°C
2. Place a V60 dripper with a paper filter on a cup or carafe and rinse the filter with hot water. Discard the rinse water
3. Add 12g of medium grind coffee to the filter
4. Pour a small amount of hot water over the coffee grounds to bloom for 30 seconds
5. Slowly pour the remaining hot water over the coffee grounds in a circular motion
6. Allow the coffee to finish dripping through the filter (total brewing time should be 3–4 minutes)
7. Remove the dripper and discard the used grounds
8. Stir the coffee
9.Enjoy your freshly brewed V60 coffee

1. Boil water and let it cool slightly to around 85–90°C
2. Pour 20–30ml of sweetened condensed milk into a cup or mug
3. Place the Phin (Vietnam drip) filter on top of the cup
4. Add 12g of medium grind coffee to the filter, then level the surface by shaking the filter slightly
5. Pour a little hot water (about 20 ml) into the filter to wet the coffee and leave for 30–45 seconds for the blooming process
6. After blooming, slowly pour the remaining hot water into the filter. Let the coffee drip slowly into the cup
7. After all the coffee water has dripped, stir the coffee with the sweetened condensed milk until well mixed
8. Enjoy your freshly brewed vietnamese coffee

1. Boil 50 ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling until it cools down a bit (around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12 grams of finely ground coffee (around 2 tablespoons) into a cup or mug
3. Pour 50 ml of boiled water into the cup or mug
4. Stir until well blended
5. Put the avocado, sugar and milk into a blender. Blend until smooth and creamy
6. Pour the smoothie blender into a collin glass
7. Pour the coffee from the cup into a collin glass (with the smoothie blender on top)
8. Add ice cubes on top
9. Enjoy your freshly avocado coffee

1. Boil 30–40 ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling until it cools down a bit (to around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12 g of finely ground coffee (around 2 tablespoons)
3. Add matcha powder
4. Add sugar (optional)
5. Pour the hot water over the coffee grounds in a cup and stir with a spoon until well mixed
6. Pour 150 ml of hot milk into the French press
7. Whisk the milk with the French press until it reaches a height of about 1 cm from the initial height continuously
8. Make sure the foam is even (no bubbles), then pour it into the milk jug
8. Pour the milk from the milk jug into the coffee cup using a tilted circular motion until the cup is half full
9. Create your own latte art style
10. Enjoy your homemade matcha latte

1. Boil 200 ml of water in a small saucepan or kettle, then let it sit for 30 seconds after boiling until it cools down a bit (around 90–95°C)
2. Add 12 grams of coarsely ground coffee to the French press
3. Pour the hot water over the coffee grounds and stir with a spoon
4. Let the coffee steep for 4 minutes
5. Press the plunger slowly and evenly
6. Pour the coffee into a cup or mug and add sugar if desired
7. Enjoy your freshly brewed French Press coffee
